description.narrative:
Since December 2012, Lebanon has seen significant growth in the number of Palestinian Refugees from Syria (PRS). As of October 2015, approximately 42,350 individuals have been registered with the UNWRA (UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestian refugees in the Near East) in Lebanon. The living conditions of PRS are characterized by social and economic exclusion, work opportunities are extremely limited and legal residency difficult and unaffordable to obtain. The entire population is in dire need of humanitarian assistance in a wide variety of areas, including protection, emergency cash for food and housing, winter clothing, non-food items, health care, emergency education, psychosocial support, and environmental health.
Winter in Lebanon is harsh and prices during this period are higher while job opportunities are less, especially in the construction sector which many PRS rely on for income. These areas experience a significant drop in temperature, rains and several snowstorms between November and April which requires higher expenditureon gas, blankets, and warm clothes. This year, UNRWA is unable to meet the winterization needs of the PRS living in Lebanon. Around75% of families rely on credit as an important source of income, suggesting that UNRWAs assistance is not sufficient to help them through the winter months, in particular since the suspension of cash for housing assistance. Therefore, this year Oxfam is partnering with UNRWA to provide winter support to enable households to meeting their basic needs during the winter period.
Oxfam is partnering with UNRWA for targeting and for the disbursement of cash through UNRWAs ATM card system. Oxfam is also working with a local NGOcalled Najdeh which have strong roots in the community, working in the Palestinian camps for the past 30 years. They will be working closely with the community for monitoring and to collect information about their experience and their expenditure.
The programme will take place from January to March 2016. The cash will be disbursed in January covering two months (November and December) and inFebruary (covering January and February). Monitoring by our partner Najdeh will take place from January to March. Households residing below 500 metres will receive $100 for 4 months and above 500 metres $147 for 4 months based on the difference in average expenditure due to weather variation.
The budget for this project is 250,444 euro to support 444 total households.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain is a member of Oxfam International, a confederation of independent national organisations working in more than 90 countries. Oxfam works on six goals that support the shared vision of a just world without poverty: help people claim their right to a better life; champion equal rights for women; saving lives, now and in the future; safeguard global food supplies; help people claim a fairer share of natural resources; and increase money for basic services. For 70 years, Oxfam has been running emergency responses, development projects and campaigning at the grass roots level to tackle poverty.
